metadata.title: CVE-2021-47161 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: spi:spi-fsl-dspi: Fix a resource leak in an error handling path'dspi_request_dma()' should be undone by a 'dspi_release_dma()' call in theerror handling path of the probe function, as already done in the removefunction

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-4.15.0-159-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-4.15.0-159-lowlatency - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-lowlatency - 4.15.0-159.167
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-80-lowlatency - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-lowlatency - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1100-kvm - 4.15.0-1100.102
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1112-aws - 4.15.0-1112.119
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1054-aws - 5.4.0-1054.57~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-azure - 4.15.0-1124.137
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1055-azure - 5.4.0-1055.57~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1109-gcp - 4.15.0-1109.123
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1049-gcp - 5.4.0-1049.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-oracle - 4.15.0-1081.89
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-159.167').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.102').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.119').
